explains: adj. 孤立主义的；孤立主义者的

sentences.en: The government had to overcome isolationist opposition to the plan.
sentences.cn: 政府不得不克服孤立主义者对该计划的反对。

sentences.en: They even set up their own news agency to peddle anti-isolationist propaganda.
sentences.cn: 他们甚至建立了自己的新闻机构以散布反孤立主义思想。

sentences.en: This does not mean that America should become more isolationist.
sentences.cn: 这并不意味着美国应该更加孤立自己。
